str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Middle or Passive - 2nd Person Singular
str2: From para and the middle voice of aiteo; to beg off, i.e. Deprecate, decline, shun.
Permitted to be trodden, accessible. From the base of basis and belos; accessible, i.e. heathenish, wicked.
Belonging to old women, such as old women tell. From graus and eidos; crone-like, i.e. Silly.
An idle tale, fable, fanciful story. Perhaps from the same as mueo; a tale, i.e. Fiction.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To train by physical exercise; hence: train, in the widest sense. From gumnos; to practise naked, i.e. Train.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 2nd Person Singular

str2: To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.
Piety (towards God), godliness, devotion, godliness. From eusebes; piety; specially, the gospel scheme.
